html:
5.31.17  6:01 am   Can you answer no to this question?

     sure but i'm not going to

5.31.17  5:45 am   What do you think of mathematics?

     it's helpful, and useful

5.31.17  5:40 am   How many ponys do you own?

     it's been a while since i've counted them

5.31.17  4:08 am   would you say you get favorable press covfefe?

     i try not to pay attention to it
5.31.17  3:55 am   What's the best type of razor for my piano?

5.31.17  2:41 am   What is the aforementioned door behind the other other door?

      it is written on the door

5.31.17  1:55 am   how many things are there?

     at least 2

5.31.17  12:13 am   Will you keep making shorts?

     how about something of a more medium size

5.30.17  11:09 pm   what's the length of your new thing?

     3 minutes and 23 seconds

5.30.17  10:59 pm   is the universe nice to you

     yes, and also challenging

5.30.17  10:43 pm   Who is the female voice in your "downstairs" video?

     vicki
5.30.17  10:22 pm   what is your favorite chord? mine is a a maj7

5.30.17  10:01 pm   Why does nobody care about Idaho?

     perhaps they just don't know about it

5.30.17  10:00 pm   What are some of your reasons for not making a discord server

     none
5.30.17  9:58 pm   I'm a simple man. Answer this question and I'll be happy

5.30.17  9:55 pm   New York City is one heck of a place. You ever been?

     oh hell yeah

5.30.17  9:54 pm   If you have a ton of interests/hobbies but don't know which one(s) you should focus your energies on, and society/college demands that you need to "find your passion"... what the hell do you do?

     add an 's'
5.30.17  9:51 pm   where do you get all of your creativity? (besides your brain)
5.30.17  9:41 pm   Do you ever suffer from an existential crisis?

5.30.17  9:32 pm   Are you working alone,

     yes

      or is there anyone behind the scenes?

     just me

5.30.17  9:19 pm   how does one stay original?

      pick a rule and break it

5.30.17  8:22 pm   what's the best way to relax?

     cracking open a cold one with the boys, for sure
5.30.17  8:22 pm   How long did it take you to make the history of the world video (rough estimate if not sure)?
5.30.17  8:22 pm   why do you think people assume you are depressed?

5.30.17  8:00 pm   what do you think of the current youtube advertisement crisis? have you been affected at all

     the ad crisis that affects me is: i don't put ads anywhere on my youtube channel because i think that severely weakens the viewing experience. and yet fans will never stop trying to convince me to do it anyway, no matter how many times i explain that i will not. i am not sure if that is the crisis you are talking about
5.30.17  7:55 pm   are you depressed or anything like that?
5.30.17  7:54 pm   Why don't you use caps letters?
5.30.17  7:03 pm   star wars or star trek

5.30.17  7:01 pm   How can i uninstal autism?

     i'm not sure. i kind of wish more people would install it
5.30.17  7:00 pm   coffee, tea, or hot chocolate

5.30.17  7:00 pm   So I'll be volunteering at a youth education center this summer. My boss was like, "I like for each volunteer to develop some programming for the students based on something you know well and love." I responded that I could teach music/music theory to the kids. Then she was like, "Awesome. That'll be a great experience for them. But what's the practical use of music theory? Like in actual school." And... I did not know what she meant or how to answer. I just murmured something about rhythm and math or something. So my question: How would you answer that? Is music theory a good thing for non-musicians to just learn?

     music theory can be any way you have of understanding the music you are playing. the theory might be totally different depending on which music your playing. i'm not sure if that answers your question

5.30.17  6:56 pm   I really want to learn a musical instrument because I love to write songs/poems but I kind of have no knowledge of theory and it seems kind of hard to learn. atm im self teaching myself to play the harmonica kind of for the theory as they are cheap and I don't want to spend loads of money on an instrument that I might give up in a few months. Any advice? (and thanks for bothering to read/answer)

     harmonica might not work as your only instrument if you are doing music with lyrics. it is very hard to play harmonica and sing at the same time. maybe even impossible

5.30.17  6:56 pm   for a public forum in surprised your questions don't have more swear words

     questions only get posted if i answer them

5.30.17  6:35 pm   Do you consider yourself passive aggressive

      sometimes passive, sometimes aggressive. sometimes a mix of both, depending on what seems appropriate for the situation at hand
5.30.17  6:14 pm   yes, hello. what, in your opinion, is the worst word?

5.30.17  5:57 pm   why didn't you answer the potato question?

     which one
5.30.17  5:51 pm   What is a good question to ask you

5.30.17  5:45 pm   What is your opinion on music today?

     music is good every day. it's even good at night

5.30.17  5:37 pm   Can you explain what you did with rhythm and why on your cover of "as"?

     i did it in a triplet feel. you could call it 4/4 with triplets, or you could call it 12/8 and say there's 3 eighth notes per beat. either way there's 3 ticks per beat instead of 4 (16th notes) per beat like the original. kick is on the beat, at least in the first verse

5.30.17  5:16 pm   Out of the 4 (now 3) things you listed in one of the reality videos (improv, songs, behind the scenes/journal) which do you want to try to do next?

     it's a surprise. unless you already know

5.30.17  4:58 pm   Do you think the world/universe sometimes has trouble expressing itself,

     no

      or that we/humans sometimes have trouble understanding it?

     oh hell yeah

     Maybe a bit of both?

     i don't think so
5.30.17  4:57 pm   How can you be funny?

5.30.17  3:52 pm   What's the best way to write lyrics if you suck at poetry?

     think of something you would like to sing, not something you would like to read
5.30.17  3:50 pm   you say there's no password for the reality section of this site, but if that's true why does it ask for a password?

5.30.17  3:45 pm   do you have a life

     yes
5.30.17  3:23 pm   Have you ever considered going on a concert tour?

5.30.17  3:10 pm   will you add dates to the songs so that we know when they were written? i guess this might pose a problem if a song was written over several years, but it would be interesting to know

     in some cases i have posted an original artifact from the writing session, dated accordingly, on the expert page. but for some songs the process is a bit more nebulous and it's more difficult. but there are a range of solutions i have in mind, especially behind the scenes and journal videos
5.30.17  3:00 pm   What shaving cream should I use to shave my piano?

5.30.17  2:40 pm   what should i do if i have no friends

     develop your superpowers. you might not get friends but at least you'll have superpowers

5.30.17  2:11 pm   contd 5.29.17 3:41 pm so what happened in 2009 that made you realize that anything is possible and kickstarted your writing process? anything meaningful or just a random thought in your brain?

     i guess i had just been working my way toward writing for so long, and in so many ways, and felt so overwhelmed, there was no other route to take. it's kind of like you are circling around the outside of a house, trying to look for the best way in. you know there has to be a way in, but you just can't decide which way is the best way in. eventually you just have to stop circling and bash one of the walls in. surely you are strong enough now, from all the exercise you've gotten while circling the building for so long

     also, these songs that you have written but not recorded, how fleshed out are they? like do you have all the lyrics and all the notation done and just left to be recorded

     there are ones of every % complete, from 1 to 100

     or is it just lyrics/just music, etc?

     the lyrics and music are always together. at least that's the way i do it
